I enjoyed this one. Excellent card game, where you never got the same deck twice, but you could aim for themed decks. Lots of options and characters. I bought all (I though all) the DLC's and if you liked Slay the Spire, this gets REALLY close to that level of gameplay. A little easier and more relaxing, but just enjoyable. 

No complaints! (Cept in some of the wording in the cards which can take a little xp to figure out how they work.)
PC - Recomended, the game`s are realy good.

Very fun game highly recommend, the only cons id have to give it is the game doesn't give you many clear indicators of things but once you figure out that "oh this is interactable" etc its a minor enough nitpick.

An absolutely amazing game. The combat is fun, the art and story is delightful; what more could you ask for? Each class is incredibly fun in their own ways, and the sheer variety on runs makes it something I'll always crawl back to. If you like roguelikes, you owe it to yourself to try out this game.
Played it on mobile. Amazing game with absolutely nothing to complain about except: please Mr. Dev allow us to bring our mobile saves to the PC! 11/10!

Super fun Card builder.  Lots of depth of play and variety.  Replayability is high.
The PC port is horrendous, instead of full moon it should be full of bugs. Bad sprites , card interactions and clicks , everything is cringe. Not recommended on pc at all.

I would most certainly recommend this game to those interested in easy going strategy card games. I first played Night of the Full Moon on a mobile device, fell in love with the story, and was super excited to find it on Steam. Since then, the updates and additional content still leave me wanting more, even though the voice acting is a little cheesy at times.  The music and visuals are beautiful. I hope the devs continue to work on the game and I am excited to see what comes next! I especially appreciate that there is an accessibility option for those who are visually impaired so my hubs can enjoy the game too.
i love this game.
nice game
Awesome Game, Hope for More Classes Soon.
I have spent too much time and money this game on both mobile and here.... 10/10 would buy again
This game has such a fun story with various endings that make it interesting to play multiple times to unlock everything. The card game is easy to learn and dynamic as the game goes on.

Coming from someone who likes Slay the Spire, Hearthstone, & Iris & the Giant, and more, this game is fun! The free (with DLC) price tag is absolutely helpful too. 

Firstly, this game has some SURPRISINGLY stellar English voice acting. (I think I recognize Matt Mercer???)
The text translation is DECENT. It is only incorrect about a few effects, while others still make sense or can be surmised. The text quality drops off more in the DLC, sadly. 
The aesthetics and visuals are excellent. 
The story is... nonsensical. The mystery they tried to create falls flat because it is not nearly built-up enough, and the reason why I‚Äôm even fighting most of these friendly-sounding creatures is well beyond me. I just found out that under Achievements > Boss Story > Normal/Boss, that EVERY enemy has a fairly lengthy blurb. I‚Äôm pretty sure very few people will even look there, but it‚Äôs neat to know!

Mechanically, the game is decent:

The classes feel soooo good to play well. They definitely scratch that strategy & combo itch. 

It‚Äôs no ‚ÄúSlay the Spire‚Äù in terms of difficulty, clarity of understanding what‚Äôs going on, or understanding what effects are currently on you, but you really don‚Äôt need to most of the time, due to the lower difficulty. 
I DO wish the enemy‚Äôs turn could move a little slower so I could read the cards being played they play them a little better. The card play history does NOT help since it is very short, and only shows cards that did not get countered (if even that). 

A lot of the effects (specifically Chilled, Frail, and Bleeding) are pretty throw-away effects that function exactly like armor or bonus damage, but with a different name.
K

A really nice deck building game with great atmosphere.

There have been many complaints about the game being UNPLAYABLE because of those BUGS:
[list]
 [*] enemy sprites are too big and only the feet are visable
 [*] enemies' turns are slow and sluggish
 [*] bosses have way too much HP
[/list]

Unfortunately, the developer didn't fix this issue, but if this happens to you, then you can fix it by changing your date / region setting to English. I made a small guide how to do that in Windows 10:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2365423390

[hr][/hr]
Edit:
Wow, this game is even better than I first thought. (slight spoiler)
[spoiler]I just finished my 2nd playthrough on hard mode, which was also my 2nd time playing as Ranger, and I accidently discovered a whole new area with the TRUE final boss. And I'm really hyped right now, because though I was still struggling with building a decent ranger deck, and though my deck was not that great, I was able to beat it on my first try, because I had some cards which I took on a whim and which turned out to make a really good combo.

I didn't play Slay the Spire, so this is my first game of this kind and I didn't have much experience in this stuff. That's why I'm so excited about it.[/spoiler]

Overall, what I really like about this game is how you first start weak, and then you gradually discover more and more cards, until you piece them together to form strong combos, in sometimes very unexpected ways. It's just so satisfying when you discover new strategies and when these work out. This, combined with the awesome atmosphere of audio and visuals is giving me such a good and unique experience to justify buying all DLCs just out of pure gratitude. At least for me.
The Wrong Gift isn't working on steam for myself. Works on mobile. Game is very fun.
good

Hidden gem to play. no regrets. its a shame you still have to be online to have the dlcs.

Recommended dlc so far: soul hunter because you can have one card from enemy permanently.

ive been playing this game on moblie But i notice pc is more good than mobile 
Good Graphics and Amazng Hud for pc
very fun game. I enjoy imagining the little red using those all mighty powerful skills to defeat monster in animation. It could be very very cool. also the story has dark twist. i enjoyed it.

I own this game on both Android and Mac. I must say I absolutely love it. Very basic concept (and its a good thing), awesome art, soundtrack that fits perfectly, voice-overs that feels like listening to a parent telling a bedtime story... Only downside is the 21:9 aspect ratio issues but it does not affect gameplay and it is understandable considering only few players play this game on 21:9 monitor.

Final words: Try it, then buy it. Its relatively cheap and has free version. Devs deserve to be supported. Awesome game.
An amazing game and I love the theme of it all

ok, ive bought this on my phone and now i got this on pc... Its awesome the animations are fun to watch and the enemies all have different approaches and abilities to try and kill you. what got me so addicted to this game where the different classes and cards u get to use. the only thing i noticed is that the dialogue sometimes differ from what is written, but other than that its ok. i recomend this game to people who love card games and to relax a bit...UNTIL YOU GET TO THE FINAL BOSS THAT IS!!!

Fantastic game.  The story, art style and of coarse the gameplay.  Money model is very fair.  Basically 10$ for full game.  Tons of replay value.  Very interesting characters that create very different play styles.
10/10
